alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 10 at 3:23PM MDT until September 10 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Natrona County in central Wyoming... * Until 400 PM MDT. * At 322 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Teapot Rock, which is also 31 miles north of Casper, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 300 PM, one inch hail was reported between mile marker 16 and 18 on Hwy 259. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Teapot Rock around 335 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Antelope Hills. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 206 and 216. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
